website_summaries.verdict: An attractive, spacious feeder that has both nice features and a few quality concerns that are potentially frustrating if you prefer a model that is basic.
pros: Stands out for being super easy to fill with its large opening
Has a spacious jar and 10 feeding ports
cons: Nectar sometimes fails to flow from the jar into some of the feeding ports
2-part system is a great concept, but a bit challenging to disassemble for cleaning

customer_reviews.title: LOCK THE BOTTOM BEFORE ADDING NECTAR
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in the mail, and need to warn you about the packaging. BEFORE adding your nectar, check that the two bottom pieces are LOCKED together. The picture that I added shows the unlocked position on the left, and the LOCKED position on the right. Very subtle, but critical. I didn't even think to check.... spent an hour wiping up sticky nectar from my floor, rug, counters, and cabinets. When I hung it outside, I immediately got several hummingbirds. It has a very small profile, but holds quite a bit of liquid. As long as you know about the bottom ahead of time, this feeder should be great !
customer_reviews.author: Santa Cruz Mountains

customer_reviews.title: Good Bye Ants!!
customer_reviews.text: My poor Hummingbirds never had clean sugar-water. It was constantly Ant ridden and I hated looking at it and having to clean it on a daily basis. Then I saw this beautiful red contraption!! As usual, I was skeptical about this working. I mean, c'mon, Ants get everywhere, so why not find a way around the moat? Well, they surely tried, and completely failed!! See from my pic? DEAD ANTS or in the process of drowning - makes me a happy girl. My pretty red tulip KILLER works amazingly and I'm going to order a 2nd one for my other feeder! Thank you First Nature!!
customer_reviews.author: gingersnap

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you live in area of hot summers
customer_reviews.text: At first I was happy with this feeder because of the ease of cleaning. Then the weather got hot and I found out that this feeder has a major design flaw. The red cap just snaps onto the plastic bottle. The cap does not snap onto the bottle tightly enough to stay secure in hot weather. As the temperatures climb into the upper 80s, the cap expands (and/or the bottle shrinks) and releases the bottle onto the ground below. I have 2 feeders and they both do this. Very unhappy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki P

customer_reviews.title: This is a great feeder. The important thing is that it comes ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great feeder. The important thing is that it comes apart for easy cleaning so no mildew needs to build up. I've had hummers all winter long w/ 7 at one time at their "feeding trough". They seem to like it there on the deck railing more than the one I have attached under the eves.
customer_reviews.author: joanne c

customer_reviews.title: Birds Love to Chill Here
customer_reviews.text: The proof this feeder rocks is this: The first one I bought worked beautifully, but got messed up when the apartment building got painted; while I waited for the re-ordered one to arrive, I didn't want the hummers to starve, so I bought the standard tall skinny feeder they sell in pet stores. Not one hummer wanted to bother with it. As soon as the First Nature one arrived, five birds descended on it literally within 30 seconds of putting it up. They like the rim that they can sit on and relax while eating; it looks like a birdie dive bar with several birds perched on it at any given time.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Webb

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap construction - lasted two weeks
customer_reviews.text: First, this feeder has some nice design features such as the perch and numerous feeding locations. In addition, it is small enough that you don't waste a lot of food and the food you do put in stays fresh because it must be frequently refilled. However, the liquid container is the cheapest most flexible "jar" I've ever seen. Within a week the jar and feeder were falling out of the hanger. Unfortunately after the fourth time it fell out of the hanger it broke for good. Would I recommend it? Absolutely not when there are so many other nice ones out there that have glass "jar's" or at least sturdier plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Engel

customer_reviews.title: Great until I stored it after one year
customer_reviews.text: Similar to another review I saw. Used it for one year, worked great. Cleaned it, put it away and just got it out for spring. Something happened to the clear plastic container. The bottom screws on well; the top will no longer fit on the top part of the container. Not only did it shrink, it's not even close to fitting. Why the top of the container is so much smaller and the bottom still fits is totally beyond me. I can use it for just sitting it on something but it won't hang because the top with the hanger won't fit on.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Draws Them In!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to the ratings here at Amazon and have not been disappointed. It started with one male hummingbird, then 2, and now about 5 hummingbirds. They literally chase each other off trying to get to this feeder and so, usually there is only one at a time on it, sometimes two. So, though it is a lower priced model and plastic, it does not leak and works extremely well. As long as my hummingbirds are happy, I'm happy, too. I also use this hummingbird nectar, which they also seem to love. It uses a combination of sucrose and dextrose.All in all, both together seem to be a very winning combination.
customer_reviews.author: mntngal100

customer_reviews.title: Plastic melted after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this feeder would be ideal. The size was nice but the important parts of the feeder are made out of plastic as thin as a disposable water bottle. The top is a harder plastic that snaps over the liquid holding container. When the sun hits the feeder it melts the plastic and the shrinks and then falls out of the top that holds the feeder :( It came crashing down on to our deck twice and then we had to toss it. Not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Evonne

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: When I received this product it appeared to be just what I was looking for. Nice size and an attractive addition to my front yard. HOWEVER...After just 45 days of use, the cheap plastic had degraded in the sun so much that it literally fell apart! The nectar reservoir fell off from the main hook it had degraded so bad. It can't be repaired. This product can't hold up to sun as it is just too cheaply made. If Amazon had any type of Quality Assurance Department, I would definitely be demanding my money back! It lasted just long enough that I can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Just wait and wait

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. It is indeed easy to clean. Attractive, Holds the appropriate amount of nectar to me. I don't like the ones that hold so much nectar that it spoils before they get done with it. But of course if you're lucky enough to have 20 birds feeding (like one of these other lucky people I saw with the video, Wow! ) you need one that holds a bunch. I never have that many, seems like maybe 4 or 5 at my feeder. I love watching them. The reason for a mediocre rating is, when you compare it to other plastic products of that size, it costs way too much.
customer_reviews.author: JC Web

customer_reviews.title: Not bee proof.. more like bee prone.
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy cleaning aspect and size. Most feeders are too big, since you really should refill them every 1-4 days depending on weather, this makes it impossible to waste nectar. The negative is that the yellow flower holes are too wide and attract bees. I noticed a bee squirming it's way out of the flower, though it was stuck, but actually the bees were attracted to the yellow flowers and found a way to squirm in and out of the feeder ports... they did this all day. The humming birds still ate from it, but it will get dirtier faster with these bees going in and out of the container at ease. Se video.
customer_reviews.author: Meggen

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hummingbird feeder 5 months ago and I can no longer reuse it. The red top (that has the hook on top) will no longer stay attached to the unit. This prevents me from being able to hang the unit. Very disappointed. I have been hanging it for months and yesterday I changed the water, re hung it and the top separated from the rest of the unit, causing the unit to fall the ground. I tried again thinking I had hung it wrong, but the same thing happened.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Attracted hummers right away
customer_reviews.text: I filled this and put it outside and within 5 minutes got my first hummingbird. Seems well constructed, was easy to open and I like the built-in ant guard. Should be simple to clean. Nice value, good product.
customer_reviews.author: SMO

customer_reviews.title: Great Feeder, Easy to Clean, Attracts Hummingbirds
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews, found cleaning is an important aspect. This feeder can be completely opened to thoroughly clean. It holds about a cup of "Nectar". I put it up and the same day, had a pair of Hummingbirds take advantage. I've had it through a couple of 100 deg. heat waves, and the feeder did not have any shrinkage or warping issues. Cleaning it is quick and easy. The ant dam on the top helps a bit, though ants are pretty amazing. They sometimes drop from above, so it is not a complete solution. My unit came with a small plastic snap hook that works perfectly to hang it. Very happy with the value, quality and function.
customer_reviews.author: R Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean, easy fill!
customer_reviews.text: Great hummingbird feeder... very compact if you like to put it near a window so you can watch your flying jewels. Opens up completely so you can really scrub all the bacteria out, great design! Nice large opening so it's easy to pour the sugar water in straight from a cooled saucepan, no funnel needed. Also sits flat on the countertop so it's not rolling around while you're trying to fill it. The top is a little flimsy... not a huge fan of just snapping the top anti-ant cover on, but I don't want to melt the feeder by using super glue. Also, it's survived squirrels without falling to the ground, so that is testament to it's sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Tassin

customer_reviews.title: Love feeder as much as my hummingbirds do!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I was a bit skeptical at first, but these feeders ROCK! I have had no ants, no bees, and the food disappears in 3 days. I am so glad I bought 2 more. By the way, when you clean them after each empties, please remember to dismantle the feeder dish and bottom. Dirt tends to build up in there. Also, when putting feeder back together, just be sure the bottom dish and feeder top are securely fastened before placing on top of bottle. You should have no leakage of bugs in your feeder. I love these things almost as much as the hummingbirds do. Get more than one; you will need them.
customer_reviews.author: peachykeen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and to clean
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this looked a bit small but it holds around 2 cups of water. I took it apart to clean it today and it came apart with ease and using an old toothbrush cleaned up easily. This is a huge feature as I was able to get the bit of black "stuff" off with ease and get it back together with ease. Even the yellow flowers pop on and off easily. Although it is plastic it seems like it will last a long time. Mine is under the eaves. I used the Veg Dangler Suction Cup Window Hanger by Window Garden LLC. Happy with that also.
customer_reviews.author: K&G columbus ohio

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this item 5 stars across the board because the birds absolutely love it; however, the only complaint I have is that while it is hanging it separates from the top and falls to the ground. I fixed it by using Velcro to hold the two pieces together better. Even though this happened, I ordered a second and did the same thing before using it. I have had a lot of different feeders and like this one the best.
customer_reviews.author: HGra

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I hung the feeder in front of my kitchen window and in the shade. I have had many humming birds visit and use. After 4 month of late spring and summer use, the feeder has fallen apart. It has always been used in a reasonable fashion and in the shade. It has fallen apart, the plastic top will no longer fasten to the plastic storage container, the bottom which screws on the storage container has come apart and leaks. It can not longer be used or even repaired. I would think I should be able to get more than 4 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: G. Freeland (Livermore, CA)

customer_reviews.title: Wide mouth, easy to clean reservoir
customer_reviews.text: The design is great, and I love the size because I prefer to clean frequently, the biggest obstacle to that is the small opening and it is hard to reach in and scrub the very end of the container even with a bottle cleaner. This completely solves that issues. Only two small negatives that are not negatives for myself, but may be for someone else. For some reason I was expecting a glass jar. No way to throw this in the dishwasher and not expect it to melt. Also the bottom of the feeder is not easily taken apart to clean. Anyone with fine mobility issues will likely struggle with that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeder that the birds seem to dig
customer_reviews.text: I like the low squat profile, compare to the long line feeders. The perch ring is great. The birds learn quickly that they don't have to be airborne while feeding. The only slight con is that the refill is from the bottom. You have to turn it upside down to twist open the perch ring. Any remaining liquid would be wasted (can't flow back to the hanging part of the feeder. I tend to wait until the nectar is almost gone before I take it down to clean and refill. It is easy to clean. I haven't had the problem of insects crawling inside or wasps coming around but that may just be where I live.
customer_reviews.author: Anony MouseTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Yikes the body melted!!
customer_reviews.text: Put the feeder up, easy to fill, the hummers loved it, brought it in for a refill, washed right up. Poured the sugar refill which I had boiled into the body turned it over and turned it over and out poured the new drink. The body had melted and the top wouldn't hold. I'm ordering a new one, but I guess you can't boil the sugar water. Anyone else have this kind of experience. I thought you had to boil the sugar water to protect the birds?? Maybe just let it fully cool ?? All advice appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: gmameg

customer_reviews.title: Not Strong Enuf to Hold it’s Weight
customer_reviews.text: The product has a top lid that snaps on to the reservoir. That lid does not snap on firmly enough to hold the weight when the feeder is full. Several times I’ve come out and seen the reservoir and feeder unit in the crashed on my patio deck and the top lid still hanging from the eave. Very frustrating. So, I used duct tape to thicken the snaps and tighten the connections. That did the trick for now, but how long will it last? And the next time it falls will the feeding tray bottom crack open?
customer_reviews.author: TODMTNS

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. And the S hook is a fail, buy a different feeder...
customer_reviews.text: Initially thought this was a nice little hummingbird feeder. The hummingbirds liked it and had no trouble feeding or perching. The main compartment is easy to clean. The base is a little work, but opens up to clean. But the S hook at the top is cheap plastic, kinda narrow and isn't long enough, so in strong winds the feeder was occasionally falling down. We tried replacing it with our own metal S hook from the hardware store, which seemed to remedy the problem, but then the top red section kept disconnecting from the rest of the feeder, and then the rest of the feeder kept falling to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic777

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: Love love this hummingbird feeder. It looks flimsy but is not. It comes completely apart for cleaning - by hand. But you can get the clear reservoir clean since you can reach inside with a sponge. The tray is easy to clean and it all goes back perfectly. The birds seem to like it too. This is my 4th one. The first one still looks as good as the last one and this is after the hot Mississippi summer sun. Someone has designed a great hummingbird feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: I like these hummingbird feeders except for the top. I'm not sure why the top part that you hang the feeder from comes apart from the part that holds the hummingbird food. It has small grooves to hold it but they are way too small and don't do a very good job. The slightest tug on it and it comes apart causing the feeder to fall to the ground. Instead of spending more money on new ones, I superglued the two pieces together and they are holding up ok. Other than that, I like the shape of them and how much hummingbird food they hold.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy !
customer_reviews.text: Feeder had mold in it when it arrived, no biggie- bleached it out. Then, the top hook portion didn't clatch onto the clear feeder. Got out the glue gun to attach them. After I filled the feeder, I realized the base doesn't EVEN fit onto the feeder. What a disaster. I got 3 parts that didn't even go together, but do look exactly like the picture there.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Rinella

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbird feeder recieved with parts missing
customer_reviews.text: This is the second feeder I have ordered, the first one came broken and this one has no way for the top section to attach to the plastic feeder. Parts must be missing, I've tried everyway to get this to work, would rather keep it then go through the process of returning it, but this is a disappointment for sure, especially since I have hummingbirds around my roses and wanted to get a feeder near by. I really feel like there isn't anyone checking the items to ensure they are complete prior to shipping.
customer_reviews.author: J. Swann

customer_reviews.title: LOVE, Hummingbird (and other kinds) favorite!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best feeder ever! I bought several over the years from other brands, mostly glass- but these simple but cute plastic feeders are great. Hummingbirds at two different houses took to it right away- AND also other birds like creoles and a few others that apparently like to visit Hummingbird bars. Highly recommend, love those and will always get replacements if I should need them. Proofs again, that sometimes simpler feeders work just as well if not better. Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.author: Susanne D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design and style
customer_reviews.text: Well made and just the size I like as it doesn’t hold too much and easy to clean. Fast cleaning makes everyone happy. Most of the birds will sit and eat and maybe pop over a flower or two and some will hover and eat. I like these feeders a lot. I do replace them after every second or third season depending on the plastic. When you see it get weathered and breaking down drying out it’s time to get a new one and thankfully these are well priced to do that.
customer_reviews.author: GoofyWhiteGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: My expensive Hummingbird feeder was causing the little guys some frustration because there was no place for them to land so I picked up this one. Yes it's plastic so out in the sun it's days are numbered but with the little perch around the rim the birds can sit and drink to their fast-bearing hearts content. Great design, just too bad it's not made of a better material. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Steve Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The hummingbirds love it, but the seam leaks.
customer_reviews.text: The bottom section of this feeder comes apart for cleaning, but the seam where it comes apart leaks, at least after a few weeks of use. This tends to drain the nectar prematurely, and the drops of nectar that accumulate attract other birds besides hummingbirds, which chase the hummingbirds away. The days where we live are regularly 100°, so it could be the heat causing this. Might be ok in a cooler area?
customer_reviews.author: eds65

customer_reviews.title: Messy to Fill
customer_reviews.text: As summer ends, do does my flower garden. Lots of humming birds still searching for nectar, so I decided to try a hummingbird feeder. This one seemed compact. But...what a mess trying to fill!!! Lots of nectar ends up everywhere. By the time it gets hung up, you've left a sticky mess behind as much has already leaked out. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ciao  Bella

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with these feeders at first, then after a couple weeks of use, went outside to find the feeder had dropped out of the red holder!?!? I assumed it was a faulty feeder, but now the second one is doing the same thing! The top red part that you hang the feeder with just snaps on, so when it gets hot, it easily drops the rest of the feeder. So disappointed because it happened after the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Sue McArthur

customer_reviews.title: Great Hummingbird Feeder!
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is rather compact and is easy to hang from a branch on my Rose of Sharon Shrub-bush. The Hummingbirds really like having a little "ledge" to sit on while drinking their Sugar Water! NOTE---Make SURE when you put this together, you make sure it snaps, LATCHES together for the bottom section of this feeder!! It can look like it is tight, but make sure it snaps shut!!! Other than making sure of that, it is a GREAT Feeder!!!
customer_reviews.author: DHB

customer_reviews.title: If you like bees
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine built feeder it's not the manufacturers fault but I've only been able to attract bees. Tons and tons of bees. No matter where I hang it and the nectar splashes out so easily from the little holes that it got all over the wall and tree so there's bees all over it. I'd return it but I can't even grab it. The low rating is for the item itself and my level of regret for buying it. Not the product durability or whatever. it's basic and fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nasha

customer_reviews.title: I have 4 of these, very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We have 5 hummingbird feeders, 4 of them are this model. The other is a 30-oz feeder, also by First Nature. Pros: Very easy to clean, easy to fill, many ports for feeding, holds up well over time. Cons: None, except I wish it were a little bigger (in other words, I wish it held more nectar) We get summer hummer "swarms" around dusk, when we have 8-10 birds fighting for a spot at these feeders!
customer_reviews.author: Jaylady

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds love it. Sturdy. Can see the level easily. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: The hummingbirds love it. I do have to remove each yellow flower plastic bit to clean but better that than poisoning my birds. There are about 12 I think. Use a toothpick, the holes are tiny. Love the ant moat, no ants! If some of the plastic bits on the inside of the reservoir were polished flush to the surface, less of a trap for bacteria or whatever else that grows on those bits.
customer_reviews.author: erudite

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your sugar water isn't hot..... <sigh>
customer_reviews.text: I've fed hummingbirds for years....bought this feeder to replace one of several old ones. When used VERY CAREFULLY it will serve well...the birds like it. BUT....I've always had glass or hard plastic feeders in the past and my practice has been to dissolve the sugar into the water using the microwave and then pour the (fairly warm, but not boiling) solvent into the feeder. Note that the clear plastic sugar-water container is NOT tolerant of hot water....it will deform and the feeder will be unusable. This is, I suppose, my own fault, but I'm pretty dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Pleva

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and does not leak.
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased the slightly larger size and it worked great, so I decided to purchase the smaller size. I like it as well. Its easy to clean and does not leak.However you can only fill it about half way or it comes detached from the top, and the ant moat isn't as deep so you have to check the water daily or you get ants in the nectar.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Runyan

customer_reviews.title: Design good for hummingbirds--can rest on perch
customer_reviews.text: Love the design of this product. Someone was REALLY thinking well. Numerous holes (although hummingbirds still fight and aren't too good at sharing). What is especially clever is the perch that goes all the way around on the bottom. The birds can sit and rest and eat. Don't have to use all that energy fluttering while they eat as is the case in so many hummingbird feeders. All pieces come apart nicely for cleaning. Small thin bottle brush can clean all the individua flower holes from mold that tends to grow. Bought two--one for my home and one for business. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H Williams

customer_reviews.title: Worst Fall-apart Junk
customer_reviews.text: I misplaced my glass hummingbird feeder, so I purchased this one. Just as I was trying to hang it on our outdoor hook the whole thing just fell apart! I tossed this piece of plastic crap immediately. Fortunately I found my older Glass feeder because we have lots of hummingbirds at our feeder, by the window, entertaining our 2 cats. Don't purchase a Plastic bird feeder of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: CindiWindi

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat this one!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several designs of hummingbird feeders, both plastic and glass. For various reasons, I keep going back to this specific feeder. It is durable, so it lasts a long time. Our hummingbirds prefer to drink out of this feeder than any other style I have tried. It holds an adequate quantity even in the busy season when new hummingbirds are born. So after much trial and error, this one is my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the other feeder I bought at the same time
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cute feeder and at first the birds seemed to like it. Then after a big rain storm I noticed the Nector was fuller and the birds would not go to it..The other 1st nature feeded (same company) as this one was getting all the attention. I took it down and tried to clean it and the top was loose but would not come off, even with warm water. I am so disapointed as this was fun to watch at first. I did order another of the 1st nature feeders and the bird are flocking to it.
customer_reviews.author: jpkantqs

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Hummingbirds Coming
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice hummingbird feeder. I’ve had many hummingbirds coming to feed every day. I bought 2 of these feeders because hummingbirds are very territorial and having 2, brings many more hummingbirds. The only problem I had is the top disconnected from the nectar storage jar from one of the feeders and it kept falling. I had to glue it together. Nonetheless, I definitely recommend this feeder because of all of the hummingbirds gathering around my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Deb613

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size hummingbird feeder
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of this hummingbird feeder. It is easy to fill and clean also. The local hummingbirds seem to like it better than the other, bigger style I have hanging nearby. I was not compensated for this review. (but I wouldn't mind if they gifted me a second one!) I also recommend making your own syrup for the feeder. Homemade is easy and it's better for the birdies. 1/2 c sugar, 2 cups water. Bring to boil stirring for 2 minutes, then cool before using.
customer_reviews.author: Shopgirl5934

customer_reviews.title: feeder capacity is only ~12oz, not 16 oz
customer_reviews.text: The hummingbirds seem to like it. There is enough room for multiple birds. My only criticism is that the capacity is only ~12oz, not 16 oz, not a deal breaker, but annoying. I wanted a larger feeder. Update: the feeder is useless. The red top separated from the liquid container. I can’t hang it up any longer. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My hummingbirds are happy year round
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first First Nature hummingbird feeder in 2018. Because a male hummingbird got too dominating and would not share it with other hummingbirds, I bought a second one in 2019 to hang at a different location. The feeders work well to attract hummingbirds, and the bee guards also protect against bee invasion. It has been more than two years since I got my first feeder, and I have not encountered any quality issues with any of the feeders. Cleaning is super and only takes about a few minutes each day when I refill the nectar.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Birds love them --EASY to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: I want to add my enthusiastic praises. During midsummer we host dozens of hummingbirds, so I have several of these in both 16- and 32-ounce sizes. The birds love them and this is the only brand that is easy to clean. Everything comes apart with no crevices to scrub. I change my feeders almost every day during the warmest days and clean them out with a simple dish mop. I put the flowers into a jar with some detergent, and a good shakeup with rinse does the trick. The whole process takes less than a minute. During the height of the season I skip the flowers altogether to make things simpler. Enjoy the birds without the fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: I own another First Nature hummingbird feeder (which I love and which even survived a bear chomping on it) ...
customer_reviews.text: I own another First Nature hummingbird feeder (which I love and which even survived a bear chomping on it) and wanted to try a different shape--something that perhaps wouldn't swing as wildly in the wind (which spills the nectar). This is a stubby-looking feeder compared to the others I've owned, but the hummingbirds are eating at it and that's all that matters! It hasn't been terribly windy yet, so I don't know how this feeder will handle the wind. There are many ports for the hummers to choose from--considering how territorial these creatures are, I do wonder if more than two hummers (on opposite sides) will eat simultaneously. "Can't we all just get along?"
customer_reviews.author: jetchick717

customer_reviews.title: Very easy cleanup! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many hummingbird feeders but NONE were these simple to use. Easy clean because it has a wide mouth opening. Take apart and put together with a simple twist. Bugs do not get inside like they did with other feeders and if they do they get caught in a built in ant trap. What took a long time cleaning the hour glass feeders is no more. 5 minutes tops This is designed to last and I’ll buy more next year.
customer_reviews.author: jin

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews before filling with nectar!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have seen the review By Santa Cruz Mountainson April 12, 2016 LOCK THE BOTTOM BEFORE ADDING NECTAR... I put this feeder up yesterday and as you can see by my photos the damn thing leaked and is not attracting hummingbirds, but I do have a whole swarm of bees lol. Once all the nectar is gone and the bees leave I will take it down, lock the bottom and then fill it back up. It's a nice feeder other than the leaking part.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. VB

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds came near but never used
customer_reviews.text: It did attract the hummingbirds. I placed it very near the plant with pink flowers where they come 3 times a day to suck nectar from the flowers. They would sit on it but never ventured to suck. May be yellow color should be replaced with red or pink color or may be the yellow flower design should resemble long neck natural flowers. I noticed sparrows coming and sucking but not humming birds
customer_reviews.author: Govardhan Muthigi

customer_reviews.title: Best Feeder I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is a great feeder. Having a big neck allows for bottle brushes to be used to clean the inside. The stands it has are great for hummingbirds to rest while eating. The mote at the top is great to prevent ants from invading the feeder. I live in a very hot place so the water was evaporating quite fast so I added cooking oil instead. Now I don’t need to worry about ants taking over the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: D. Riordan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I wanted very specific things and got them. 1st. the bottle SCREWS INTO the base. SO important. Less dripping and leakage. Also you can put more nectar in, without worrying the bottom will fall off if you touch it. 2nd it's got a small bottle that is easier to handle. 3rd, it's adorable and has a ton of places to feed. SO glad I bought it and it arrived overnight!
customer_reviews.author: S Goryan

customer_reviews.title: It's cute, but not the sturdiest.....
customer_reviews.text: While I don't mind this feeder, the clear plastic that holds the nectar "crunches or buckles in" when cleaning or putting the bottom back on. Also, once filled and hanging I've had the clear plastic feeder let loose from the hanger top and I have nectar all over - this has happened twice already, so I don't put much nectar in the feeder and that seems to have solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S

customer_reviews.title: but it looks just as nice as the glass feeders
customer_reviews.text: It's plastic and sort of cheap feeling, but it looks just as nice as the glass feeders, and now I don't have to worry about broken glass if a bear tears it down. Also, the hummingbirds like this feeder more than others I've used, probably because the ring around it is close enough to the "flowers" that hummingbirds can reach and land while they drink. Has a surprising amount of capacity for how relatively small it looks, and a lot of flowers for the hummingbirds to try, so they seem to stick around longer than with other feeders.
customer_reviews.author: Some guy and a pug

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: We don't have too many hummingbird s in winter but just after a couple of days this feeder attracted 4 different birds who became recurrent visitors. It proved to be more fascinating than I expected. Hummingbirds can remember feeding locations well and will come back. This feeder is easy to open and to fill. Plastic feels solid. Make sure you give birds a sugar solution (about 25% w/w) and not agave or splenda. I know for a fact that some people have done just that.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo

customer_reviews.title: Nectar jar made of shrink wrap
customer_reviews.text: I always boil my nectar, so having read the warning I boiled it in a pan, let it cool for about ten minutes and poured it into the feeder which seems to be made out of shrink wrap. It contracted by a about 20 percent and could no longer be attached either to the top or bottom. Luckily the threads on the bottom match a bicycle bottle I had and some two sided tape worked for the top. I have nothing against plastic but the container is half the guage of a gallon milk jug.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best hummingbird feeder design so far
customer_reviews.text: been through them all.. this is the perfect design and size, unless maybe you have have herds of nectar-guzzling hummingbirds. prevents spoilage since you're forced to fill it and keeps ants out if you keep the built-in moat watered. and has perches. and easy to get inside for cleaning. practice locking and unlocking it using just water a few times before you fill it. I put it on a little lawn table, elevated on a short glass upended in a round, shallow tray that i partly fill with water to keep ants from getting in that way. drawback: no hummingbirds yet
customer_reviews.author: VOTE HIM OUT

customer_reviews.title: Great product and Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased this bird feeder several months ago and were so please with it that we ordered another. The second one arrived with one yellow flower missing, but we decided that it was no big deal. However, we got an email from the seller asking if we were happy with everything so I responded that yes but we were missing a flower. They immediately mailed out a package with several extra flowers and a handwritten note! The feeder comes apart easily to clean thoroughly. The birds are very happy with it and so are we!
customer_reviews.author: L. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Falls Off
customer_reviews.text: Look at my photo. That’s where the feeder USED TO BE. The red lid is not tight enough around the bottle, so it falls off. A better design would snap or screw the bottle to the lid for a secure fit. Next, I’ll wrap duct tape around it. I shouldn’t have to do that. So recommendation is to look for a better feeder. Or simply save the money and just pour sugar water all over the ground yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: My favorite style of hummingbird feeder!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have purchased different styles of hummingbird feeders. Some were expensive and looked really nice, but my hummingbirds like this one the best. I must of had at least a dozen hummingbirds in my yard this past summer. Many with distinctive features. Even gave some names. Most of my hummingbirds perch when eating and this feeder is perfect. I have three of these set out around my yard and this summer there was always a hummingbird at one of them.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: We got this in an "emergency", since one of our others broke. It is very cheap, but works okay. The hummers like our other one better. As others said, you have to remember to lock it shut after cleaning (I dumped it out the first time). Being all plastic, I'm not sure how long it will last. I will be getting another of the glass ones when they become available as a back-up.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little feeder has turned out to be one of the best hummingbird feeders we have ever had.i thought at first it might be too small but has worked out just fine.With all the little yellow flower heads all around it the hummers really like it and it doesn't have to be refilled as often as you would think. A+
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Humming birds won't drink from it.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why but I have used this at two of the houses I have lived in at least 45 min drive apart. My humming birds at each house will not use this. I don't know why. I don't know if they put something weird in it while making it or not. I have put out other ones with no issues they visit the other ones numerous times a day. If I take the other one down and put up this one they stop coming to get a drink. I am baffled.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an older glass version I owned. This has a large mouth container making it easy to clean and c refill. Multiple "flower" stations . Nice addition to my garden.
customer_reviews.author: JoyffreeTop Contributor: Fantasy Books

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds love all the ports!
customer_reviews.text: I like this, although I would not be able to open it without the help of my husband getting me a little flathead screwdriver to help slide it away from the latches. And even then, it’s not easy for me to grab to open. Can’t really hold the plastic as it’s kind of flimsy and pushes in. But that being said, my hummingbirds seem to love all of the ports and doesn’t seem to leak but it’s not hot out here yet.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Came apart after first use. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I’m super disappointed. At first this feeder was perfect. Easy to clean and hang. But after the second time filling, I hung it back on it’s hook, and the entire liquid holding part came unglued or disconnected from the top part with the hook. It fell to the ground and spilled everywhere. I thought it must just need to be snapped back together but after a couple more times of reconnecting the pieces, it just won’t stay together. I even tried only filling part way (to help keep it light weight) and it still broke apart. I’ve had many different styles of regular bird and humming bird feeders. I’ve never seen this happen before. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Colt or Holly

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbirds love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hummingbird feeder. It is easy to fill and the hummingbirds love it. We typically have 2-5 birds eating from it at a time and have to refill it about once a week. It's very sturdy and well made. The only thing is it is a little hard to get the bottom portion off to clean it during refills. But other than that it is great! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Megan B.

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetics‚ 0 stars. But the hummers LOVE it.
customer_reviews.text: I hate the look of this feeder. It's cheap plastic with gaudy yellow flower ports, and so the product loses a star for that. But we're overrun with pre-migration hummingbirds, and THIS is the feeder they visit the most, defend with the most vigor, and drink from the longest. The bees and yellow jackets do leave it alone because of the bee guards, but the ants are all over it. I had to add a second ant moat with a little oil in it to cut down on them.
customer_reviews.author: JKF

customer_reviews.title: Attracts the birds very well
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is when you take the bottom piece apart to clean it , it tends to leak the sugar water after that because the seal isn’t good as it was before then. But my hummingbirds love it and the size is good, when it’s bigger there’s too much waste as it turns in the heat!
customer_reviews.author: Banker lady

customer_reviews.title: It comes apart easily for thorough cleaning and has perches.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this feeder for several years and I’m crazy about it. It comes apart easily for thorough cleaning, it’s easy to fill with a wide mouth, and my hummingbirds love it over my other feeders because they can perch while feeding. My only criticism is that I would like to see a deeper ant mote on top that would hold more water. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: L. B. Lear

customer_reviews.title: My Hummingbirds LOVE LOVE LOVE this feeder!
customer_reviews.text: My little hummingbirds LOVE this feeder. But I couldn’t get the hornets out of the container part where the hummingbird food goes. Every flower hole was plugged with a dead hornet! The hornets got inside and died! I had to pull every dead hornet out one by one!
customer_reviews.author: Tigger

customer_reviews.title: Bird feet trap!
customer_reviews.text: CAUTION ⚠️ Please do not consider purchasing this feeder. I’ve saved two birds who’s claws got stuck in this seam and who were hanging upside down. You can’t put something in the seam because that is where you open it to fill. I have four of the feeders that I had to toss.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Back

customer_reviews.title: Cool the nectar first!
customer_reviews.text: Um. It gets the job done. I just want to share one advice based on my own mishap 😅 Don’t put the sugar water in while it’s warm!!!! And that goes for all plastics I know ... The clear container shrunk and I couldn’t get it to assemble any more. Don’t do what I did 😅😅
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to wash and refill
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hummingbird feeder that I have ever owned. It is smaller then some, but with the hot weather, I have found that the feeder needs to be cleaned weekly. It easily comes apart and the wide mouth opening allows for easy cleaning and filling. Hummingbirds love it.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: dead simple to clean, fill, hang
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to clean and fill. Ant moat is a little small, which just means in Texas heat the water evaporates before the hummingbirds can empty it. Plastic probably won't last long in said heat either, but for $10 shipped, who cares? The little buggers love it, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: scottwmcgregor

customer_reviews.title: Right idea, bad design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because it can be cleaned thoroughly very easily! However, for some unknown reason, the top that it hangs by is not attached very well to the reservoir. It should be permanently attached....the feeder falls all the time. Any disturbance...breeze whatever....and it's on the ground. It's barely held on my some small retainers....bad design
customer_reviews.author: HLLW

customer_reviews.title: NOT DISHWASHER SAFE (just like it states on the bottom) :(
customer_reviews.text: I found one of these at a garage sale yest. Yay me, $.50 was perfect. Seemed durable, great price. Came home and disassembled easily enough. I couldn't get the inside of the actual bottle clean tho so I popped it into the dishwasher (top rack). Yeah, don't do that. I now have a replacement feeder enroute since there is nowhere to order just the bottle portion that crumpled and melted in my dishwasher. When it says NOT DISHWASHER SAFE, trust them.
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: Top is not a secure fit
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is cute, easy to clean, very easy to hang (no S-hook or wire twisting to hang). The big problem is that even when it is only about 1/3 full, the weight of the feeder causes it to separate from the top and fall. The top is a very loose fit; so loose, in fact, it was hard to glue. I put some small furniture pads in the lid, with gorilla glue (which expands) on both sides. Works fine now; but for the price, you shouldn't have to do all this just to make it functional.
customer_reviews.author: V. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiest hummingbird feed to clean and refill that ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest hummingbird feeder to clean and refill that I have seen. Also some sparrows have figured out how to rock it so they can get the sugar water to spill out and drink it, sometimes emptying it in one day. The hummingbirds used it on the first day and have continued to do so. One last thing, it is hard to judge what the level of feed is since I use my own sugar water, the reflections off the sides have misled me more than once on thinking there is more food in there than there was.
customer_reviews.author: Tekmaniac

customer_reviews.title: BEES, BEES AND MORE BEES
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a problem with bees before, but now, its a hazard to be anywhere near this feeder - and my poor hummers can't get any nectar. The central chamber is plastic and fairly weak - it gets blown off its holder in a stiff wind. All in all, I'm throwing it out and buying a different design. Does not work for my yard
customer_reviews.author: NoFearFiona

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this feeder to replace an old one that I had trouble cleaning. This feeder has a nice large opening that is super easy to get a sponge into. One thing I've learned with hummingbirds is that you have to change out the sugar-mix at least once a week and once every couple of days in the heat of the summer. With the larger feeder (30-ounce) I was wasting about half of the sugar-mix. I live in the PNW and this feeder seems to be the perfect size for the amount of hummingbirds I get in my area.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Harris

customer_reviews.title: not dishwasher safe!
customer_reviews.text: flimsy plastic. Placed top shelf dishwasher and when removed was warped and would not screw into base. I missed the not dishwasher safe. I probably wouldn't have purchased it. I boil my nectar and clean my glass feeders in the dishwasher to avoid the risk of fungal infection in the hummingbirds. This feeder does not allow for high temperature cleaning
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bunyan

customer_reviews.title: Great basic feeder
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 of these, which tells you something right there. Great capacity, super easy to clean and fill, lots of ports (we’ve been trying to hang more feeders close together to increase our numbers of hummers, since at some point they realize they can’t defend everything and start to co-exist better) and these have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Midwesterner

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few months, then shrank
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few months. Hummingbirds seemed to like it. After 3 months the plastic container that holds the liquid is considerably smaller and won't screw into the base. Not even a little bit. Super weird, but I had read other reviews where this happened. I didn't put it in a dishwasher either. Perhaps it's the warm weather.
customer_reviews.author: CML

customer_reviews.title: Best feeder I’ve had!!!
customer_reviews.text: This hummingbird feeder is the easiest to clean I’ve ever had! The wide mouth means no part inside is beyond my reach. It was a bit hard to disassemble the base at first but has gotten easier over time. The little perch allows the hummers to perch while they feed. The birds love it and so do I.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Works, but cheap
customer_reviews.text: When we were first finding a spot to hang it, a humming bird flew right at it, without any nectar in it yet! That said, while I have barely seen use out of it in my area, I still see a bird from time to time. Quality of the plastic is the biggest concern here, and if not snug will leak your goods. Other reviews claimed they have outright broken for them, but mine 6 months on is still providing that sweet, sweet nectar.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Cute and great price
customer_reviews.text: The price was good compared to other hummingbird feeders and its very sturdy. I can see this one lasing a long time! I usually buy some from the lower end stores and eventually they end up loosening and not working well. Time will tell if this one will last more than a few years but if they do I will be back to update. Would buy again if the price stayed lower than $12.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Medina

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Apparently putting it outside when it's warm permanently shrinks the clear plastic. Found it on the ground outside in three pieces and as you can see by the video it does not go back together. I would avoid this product completely.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy B.

customer_reviews.title: Ant moat works
customer_reviews.text: Nothing will keep out flying insects, but this model's ant moat does work. You have to keep it filled up if it evaporates, but in hot weather you should be changing your nectar daily anyway. I've had a couple of models, but this is currently my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Levy

customer_reviews.title: Warps in the heat of the desert
customer_reviews.text: I live in the SW USA and during the summer the temperature is above 100 degrees daily for months. The plastic construction of this feeder can't hold up to the heat and warps (was hung in a shaded area). The top separates from the base and it will not stay attached. I would avoid this feeder if you live in a desert climate.
customer_reviews.author: SC Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best hummingbird feeder ever
customer_reviews.text: The holes are small and deep enough that hornets and wasps are frustrated. I hang the feeders high and have never seen a lot of ants on them. In Spring when the hummers first arrive, each feeder can support 10 tiny birds, sitting on the little rail and drinking steadily to restore their energy after migrating. Easy to clean and fill.
customer_reviews.author: gringa11

customer_reviews.title: Even the humming birds give it two wings up
customer_reviews.text: This the second one of this feeder I have bought. (Backyard hummers felt left out.) First one has lasted many years. See no reason the second should not last as long. Easy to fill. Easy to clean. And best of all, the humming birds use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim - Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Stupid design
customer_reviews.text: The reservoir must be unscrewed from the base to refill, so you must turn it upside down which spills all of the remaining fluid in the base. Basically, you have to wait until it is bone dry to refill or you spill the liquid all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Berry

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Easily
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several hummingbird feeders. This is the first one to provide a simple way to clean it, which is to disconnect the bottom section. It’s a great design. With that said my 2 negatives would be: -difficultly of getting the bottom piece apart -no information about ability to come apart I learned about it through 1 negative review. No guarantees on this but I hung it up one day & the next day hummingbirds had found the feeder!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but most importantly the Humming Birds do
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but most importantly the Humming Birds do! It is easy to clean since it has the larger mouth to get a bottle brush into. Only two problems. Problem 1st is trying to get the top half of the base connected firmly to the bottom of the base. No where to 'grip' to twist the two pieces together without bending the pieces. 2nd problem is, that the resercoir is flimsy. When trying to screw the base on or unscrew it, it tends to bend/collaspe.The base does however seal really well, with no dripping, which is awesome! I would difinitely recommend it, but somewhere to 'grip' would be awesome and a little sturdier plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Had 1 and hummongbirds loved it. They could sit and rest while drinking. The 2nd one I ordered didn't fit well and kept falling from the hook. Customer service replaced it promptly so now I have two feeders for the beautiful hummingbirds to drink from.
customer_reviews.author: TerryQ RN

product_meta.title: First Nature 993091-546 16 oz. Hummingbird Flower Feeder
product_meta.description: Size:1 Pack| Color:RedFirst Nature, a birding products Company, was founded in 2001 the line has grown to include an assortment of best-selling seed feeders, waterer, hummingbird feeders & easy-to-use hummingbird nectar. First Nature products feature unique & Patented designs that really attract the birds & make feeding birds easier & even more enjoyable.
feature_bullets: The bright red color attracts the most inquisitive hummingbirds
With easy-to-fill wide-mouth jar Reservoirs and two-parts bases, First Nature hummingbird feeders are the easiest feeder on the market to clean
The feeding ports will accommodate several hummer's at a time
With First Nature hummingbird nectar concentrate, you can mix the correct proportions right in the feeder jar

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,962 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
